author: sky.cactus
content: I think you want min and max block-base fee per day, even if the max is high.  That way you have an accurate idea about how high gas prices can go.  There may separately be value in 90th percentile min and max, where you filter outliers on both sides.

author: sky.cactus
content: Open and close are silly numbers for a continuous system.  They are kind of interesting when markets *actually* open and close, but they are not when you just pick a random hour each day to call open.

author: stevencook
content: is max useful?

author: sky.cactus
content: Yes, it let's users know what the volatility range is.

author: stevencook
content: min i get is useful, but max i think is more related to some nft launch

author: sky.cactus
content: It helps give people a better picture of what gas fees are really like.

author: stevencook
content: max shows a 5 min period if high fee

author: stevencook
content: 90th percentile is more realistic

author: stevencook
content: maybe 95th?

author: sky.cactus
content: I think they serve different purposes.

author: stevencook
content: ohh candlestick chart - i can get onboard with that

author: stevencook
content: i didn't read above... long day at work

author: sky.cactus
content: Really, min is all a rational actor needs.  The rest are useful for analytics and people feeling smart.  ðŸ˜†

author: sky.cactus
content: And people behaving irrationally.

author: stevencook
content: agreed

author: stevencook
content: we are computing tons of percentiles, just not sure which is best to show, with max displayed, it skews the chart too much with the amount of area dedicated to it

author: stevencook
content: which is why it's only in the hover tooltips

author: stevencook
content: if we made a page specific to percentiles, it could be a single, larger chart, and then it would give us a lot more to be able to show

author: potuz
content: I said that above as well, but nonetheless, just as with analog watches, people are trained to extract information quickly from these graphs, not stacked bars

author: sky.cactus
content: You can do a candlestick without open/close.

author: stevencook
content: i don't follow on the stacked bars - is it confusing to read what it is showing?

author: stevencook
content: i agree that candlestick would be better but i don't know if recharts supports it

author: potuz
content: Sure, if you pick any other random two measures that give boundaries to the body of the candle. But Binance and and every other trading app use an arbitrary chosen timestamp to mean open/close (like midnight UTC) and I suspect users that care about this will assume the same

author: stevencook
content: i think candlestick on hour/day/month works just fine

author: potuz
content: It's not, again just as is not confusing to see "10:24" in a digital watch as opposed to two needles, to those that are used to them, reading numbers takes a couple of extra cycles

author: stevencook
content: fair enough - i find not having any data is more confusing ðŸ™‚ this data is relatively easy to read for those that are curious to know what it is

author: stevencook
content: in a way, this is a candle graph (orange color is the black/noncolored side of candle graph)

author: stevencook
content: and most people can't read candle graphs at all

author: potuz
content: But the candle stick will have this same data as well

author: stevencook
content: but as Micah pointed out, the wick vs candle isn't so useful in this kind of chart

author: stevencook
content: since the lead-in for each period is completely arbitrary

author: stevencook
content: eg if an NFT launched at 1158pm UTC, it would look stupid with the candle base starting from top, and going down

author: stevencook
content: if instead you are referring to candle graph without wicks that might be easier for people to interpret?

author: stevencook
content: sorry it's late here and i'm not able to think as well atm

author: potuz
content: Tell me about it, it's 3:30am here :)

author: stevencook
content: haha

author: stevencook
content: it's only 1030 here but i have 2 little kids and have to drive somewhere early in morning ðŸ™‚

author: mohamed.mansour
content: We can add anything you all find useful, I really want to make the sqlite db data accessibly downloadable too in case others want to do their own offline analysis.

author: mohamed.mansour
content: Right now I think the base fee chart with min/avg/90p (with max in tool tip) is readable. I could place a line graph overlaged with another Y axis on the right side for Max <@301186049323958275> but <@552133098075193354> and many others found confusing, hence how it looks today

author: mohamed.mansour
content: <@860004003902259231> tomorrow (or tonight) it's 3am now, what I can do is add back Max in the chart and make the chart height  twice as high so that we can see everything, since the max is very far ahead than 90p maybe it will work.

author: sky.cactus
content: FWIW, I'm not lobbying for candlesticks.

author: Deleted User
content: Since blocks that are 100% full often have the lowest basefee it might make sense to consider "economical fee" to just be the basefee that was used in the last ~100% full block

author: mohamed.mansour
content: <@!301186049323958275> this is how the max looks like (had to make it 2x larger) but as you see all the other numbers are squished) The difference between 90 percentile and max is a lot. This is all the basefee from the start (106 day buckets)

author: timbeiko
content: <@!147269256042643456> can you pinpoint when things go _really_ up? is it top 1%? 5%? 0.1%?

author: sky.cactus
content: Does your charting software allow you to click on legend entries in the chart to enable/disable (and presumably re-zoom the chart based on what is being displayed)?

author: sky.cactus
content: If so perhaps just start with max disabled, but allow the user to enable it.

author: sky.cactus
content: If not, then I'm convinced for now it probably isn't worth it to present the data to users.

author: mohamed.mansour
content: I can add zooming and enable/disable, was on backlog when I have time
